name: places/ChIJIXwIAetYwokRzmxMabEoDJ8
formattedAddress: 983 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 983 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10021-5103, USA

originalText.text:
All the clothes are now too big. The prices, never mind. Not all the sales personnel is friendly or knowledgeable.
Overall, Cotelac marketing strategy in US  is pretty poor. Too bad because they used to have pretty fabrics. Next season s selection is perfectly gross. Who needs Cotelac for yellow clothes. Pipe this up the food chain.

originalText.text:
Order was confirmed and then I receive an email two days later the heavily discounted clothing was out of stock…. Really??? What international brand does not have a adequate inventory  system???  In the past  i have found the NYC store assistants to be quite pretentious and not very helpful as though you need their approval to wear their clothing.

I’m done with this brand and their poor shopping experience!

Update: Thanks for replying to a google review on a Sunday and not my customer service message.

In 2022 online shopping is pretty common, so for EVERYTHING in my cart to be out of stock after you confirmed an order is not okay.  I’m not sure you are aware, but It DOES NOT happen with a reliable inventory software.  Get it together!  It’s nearly 2023…. Your system should be reliable or at the very least, if you are not able to fulfill a confirmed order, offer some type of incentive/ discount to show you value your customer’s time and to show some level empathy.

Your email and the reply was quite terse.  Not impressed.  At all.

There is nothing particularly special about your clothing that I can’t find elsewhere and it is a bit overpriced.

Byyyyeweeeeeeee

originalText.text:
I live 2 blocks from this store and shopped here in the past a few times. I found the clothing there was cute and fitted me well, however, the service was always a challenge. Today though it went over extreme. The black lady who called herself a manger of the store was extremely rude. I asked her if they have a size zero of the dress I liked and she said no we don’t in a super rude matter. She didn’t smile or greet me and after I asked about couple more pieces and she kept being very irritated with my questions and said we order very limited edition, so I stopped asking for any sizing eventually and wanted to try what I have chosen. She game this look like she is hating me for being there in a first place.  I decided to leave and told her she should be more welcoming and she started to yell at me and Said why am i asking very obvious questions .... really ?? Isn’t she is there for that reason to help me and answer those questions ?
I asked her to give me contact of an owner of the place and she refused to give it to me. After being yelled for 10 min I left.

I will never return to this place and if you like to get good service and feel welcomed at a store do not go to this place. Horrible

originalText.text: I was drawn to Cotelac because of its unique clothing design and bought  a number of garments. Last week, however, I noticed after a few wears of a Cotelac blouse, that an area of about 4"X4" was frayed and shredding, as if it had been rubbed against an abrasive for a significant period, which did not happen either in my closet or while wearing the garment. When I brought the blouse back to the store I was told that it could be returned/refunded only within 10 days of purchase; it was well past that point. They were unwilling to do anything to address the puzzling deterioration of the blouse. Consequently, they lost a customer and all the referrals I was happy to make for them.

When I brought the blouse back to the store I was told that it could be returned/refunded only within 10 days of purchase; it was well past that point. They were unwilling to do anything to address the puzzling deterioration of the blouse. Consequently, they lost a customer and all the referrals I was happy to make for them.

originalText.text: We have been to many Cotelac locations in Europe and the US. We've had good experiences at every shop UNTIL the recent visit to the Lexington location in New York City. The two women at the store never once come by (or even looked to see if help was needed) to check or offer assistance while I was trying a few items on (I was just trying a few winter coats so I left the curtain undrawn). In fact, they never come by once to offer any help from the minute we walked in. They were not busy working but rather just standing there talking. There were no other customers. Whiĺe I was waiting to pay, one of the women asked me to get the clothes I tried before from the changing room so she could hang them back. I don't think even at GAP that they would ask you to take the clothes out, let alone this is a store in the Upper East Village. I have been to a lot of shops in upscale neighbourhoods and I have to say I was not impressed at all by the customer service at this shop.  We were totally being ignored. The shopping experience was not pleasant at all.
